title: File deletion tool fails in bug-reports directory
description: Creating a file in tests/bug-reports/ works, but deletion via the available tool fails with 'file not found' even when the file exists. This blocks automated cleanup and may indicate a deeper issue with file operations in the environment. Steps to reproduce: 1) Create a file in tests/bug-reports/. 2) Attempt to delete it using the tool. 3) Observe failure. Expected: File is deleted. Actual: Tool reports file not found.

history.details: Confirmed file exists and is accessible. Deletion tool fails, but move operation works. File was successfully renamed as a workaround. Indicates the delete tool may have a workspace sync or path resolution bug.
File was renamed twice (as a soft-delete pattern). File remains in directory but with a .deleted extension. This can be used as a temporary workaround for deletion until the root cause is fixed.

Discovered that the built-in delete_file tool only works with relative paths from the workspace root, not absolute paths. Previous failures were due to using absolute paths. Deletion with a relative path works as expected. Solution: Always use relative paths with delete_file, and absolute paths with MCP commands.

verification.result: Confirmed fix. Deletion works with relative paths as required. No further action needed.
